articles.headline: How the Golden Globes Went From Laughingstock to Power Player
articles.snippet: The group that was once assailed by the F.C.C. steadily gained influence in Hollywood over the years until scrutiny of its practices and lack of diversity led NBC to say it would not air its show in 2022.
articles.abstract: The group that was once assailed by the F.C.C. steadily gained influence in Hollywood over the years until scrutiny of its practices and lack of diversity led NBC to say it would not air its show in 2022.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The Golden Globes were created by the Hollywood Foreign Press Association in 1944 and quickly developed a reputation as unserious and slippery.
articles.byline: By Nicole Sperling and Brooks Barnes

articles.headline: In Rebuke to N.R.A., Federal Judge Dismisses Bankruptcy Case
articles.snippet: The N.R.A. filed for bankruptcy this year as it sought to end run regulatory action in New York, but a judge rejected the strategy.
articles.abstract: The N.R.A. filed for bankruptcy this year as it sought to end run regulatory action in New York, but a judge rejected the strategy.
articles.lead_paragraph: The National Rifle Association’s attempt to evade a legal challenge from New York regulators was tossed out by a federal bankruptcy judge on Tuesday, in a ruling that cast further doubt on whether the group’s embattled chief executive, Wayne LaPierre, would remain at the helm after three decades in power.

articles.headline: Bottom Drops Out of the Red-Hot Market for Electric Vehicle Start-Ups
articles.snippet: Lordstown Motors said it would start producing and selling electric pickup trucks this year, but there is little evidence it is ready to do so. Its stock has tumbled from a high of about $30 last year to around $8.
articles.abstract: Lordstown Motors said it would start producing and selling electric pickup trucks this year, but there is little evidence it is ready to do so. Its stock has tumbled from a high of about $30 last year to around $8.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lordstown Motors is one of a dozen electric vehicle start-ups that have wowed investors with big plans to revolutionize the auto industry. It won acclaim for taking over a plant whose shutdown by General Motors drew the wrath of President Donald J. Trump.
articles.byline: By Neal E. Boudette and Matthew Goldstein

articles.headline: They Haven’t Gotten a Covid Vaccine Yet. But They Aren’t ‘Hesitant’ Either.
articles.snippet: Much has been said about people opposed to or skeptical of coronavirus vaccines. But there’s another group that has yet to get shots, and their reasons are more complex.
articles.abstract: Much has been said about people opposed to or skeptical of coronavirus vaccines. But there’s another group that has yet to get shots, and their reasons are more complex.
articles.lead_paragraph: It had been weeks since Acy Grayson III, owner of Let It Shine, a home improvement outfit he runs out of his own home in the suburbs of Cleveland, had vowed to get a Covid-19 vaccine.
articles.byline: By Amy Harmon and Josh Holder

articles.headline: India’s Strict Rules on Foreign Aid Snarl Covid Donations
articles.snippet: International donors are raising millions, but the Modi administration has erected hurdles for overseas organizations and guided money toward officially endorsed groups.
articles.abstract: International donors are raising millions, but the Modi administration has erected hurdles for overseas organizations and guided money toward officially endorsed groups.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bake sales on Instagram. Online fund-raisers involving Hollywood celebrities. Pledges of aid from companies like Mastercard and Google. A middle-of-the-night flight by a FedEx  cargo plane transporting thousands of oxygen concentrators and masks.

articles.headline: Jump in Consumer Prices Raises Stakes in Inflation Debate
articles.snippet: The increase in the Labor Department’s Consumer Price Index was well above forecasts. A top Fed official acknowledged the surprise but said, “This is one data point.”
articles.abstract: The increase in the Labor Department’s Consumer Price Index was well above forecasts. A top Fed official acknowledged the surprise but said, “This is one data point.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Consumer prices jumped at the fastest pace in more than a decade in April, surprising economists and intensifying a debate on Wall Street and in Washington over whether inflation might reach levels that would squeeze households and ultimately undermine the recovery.

articles.headline: Gasoline Buying Fever Rages as Pipeline Company Begins Restart
articles.snippet: While drivers scrambled for fuel, Colonial Pipeline said supplies would resume flowing from Texas to the East Coast in the coming days.
articles.abstract: While drivers scrambled for fuel, Colonial Pipeline said supplies would resume flowing from Texas to the East Coast in the coming days.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Anxious drivers circled from one filling station to another, gasoline prices rose and thousands of stations were out of fuel in the Southeast on Wednesday as a ransomware attack continued to cripple a vital fuel pipeline.
articles.byline: By Clifford Krauss and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: Ellen DeGeneres Is Ending Her Show After Years of Dancing and ‘Be Kind’
articles.snippet: An enduring daytime TV hit suffered a sharp ratings decline after complaints of workplace misconduct clanged against the performer’s public image.
articles.abstract: An enduring daytime TV hit suffered a sharp ratings decline after complaints of workplace misconduct clanged against the performer’s public image.
articles.lead_paragraph: With the announcement on Wednesday that she will end her long-running talk show next year, Ellen DeGeneres is stepping away from her biggest platform in a career that started in a New Orleans comedy club, led her to more than 30 Emmys and the Presidential Medal of Freedom and included a late phase during which she adopted Be Kind as a motto and brand name for products she sold to her fans.
